shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Daily Office Prayers and Litanies (fols. 3ra-16ra) II) Śǝrʿatä qǝddase “Ordinary of the Mass” (fols. 16ra-42va) III) Anaphoras (fols. 43ra-135vb) III-1) Anaphora of the Apostles (fols. 43ra-52ra) III-2) Anaphora of Our Lord Jesus Christ (fols. 53ra-56ra), preceded by an excerpt from “Testament of Our Lord” (fol. 52rb-va) III-3) Anaphora of Our Lady by St. Cyriacus of Behnesa (fols. 56ra-67ra) III-4) Anaphora of St. John the Son of Thunder (fols. 67ra-76rb) III-5) Anaphora of St. Epiphanius of Cyprus (fols. 76rb-82ra) III-6) Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Hosanna-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 82ra-87va) III-7) Anaphora of St. John Chrysostom (fols. 87va-94ra) III-8) Anaphora of St. Dioscorus of Alexandria (fols. 94ra-96vb) III-9) Anaphora of St. Jacob of Serug (fols. 96vb-103ra) III-10) Anaphora of the 318 Orthodox Fathers of Nicaea (fols. 103ra-110vb) III-11) Anaphora of St. Athanasius of Alexandria (fols. 110vb-120va) III-12) Anaphora of St. Cyril of Alexandria (fols. 120va-126rb) III-13) Anaphora of St. Basil of Caesarea (fols. 126rb-132vb) III-14) Second Anaphora of St. Gregory (“Christmas-liturgy of St. Gregory”) (fols. 132vb-135vb).

donors.donor: Wäldä Mikaʾel, Gäbrä Ḥǝywät, ʾabunä Wäldä Śǝllase, Täsfa Ḥǝywät, Wälättä Ḥǝywät, Gäbrä ʾƎgziʾabǝḥer are mentioned in the supplication formulas (s. fol. 16ra, etc.).

dcomments.dcomment: On fols. 14vb and 30rb, King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913) is mentioned.

txstates.txstate: Some fols. are heavily stained with dirt.

bindings.binding: Wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather and deep rose leather. Overback made of reddish-brown leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 4 tools were used: double circle, triple line fillet, cross hatching, X-form).

bnothers.bnother: Two pairs of chains of endband stitches at the spine cover. Headband and tailband are made of folded pieces of leather.

inks.ink: Black; reddish-brown; dark red (names of the donors in supplication formulas).

squires.squire:
A(2/stubs before 1 and after 2/fols. 1r-2v) – ፩I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – VI(10/fols. 43r-52v) – VII(8/fols. 53r-60v) – VIII(8/fols. 61r-68v) – IX(8/fols. 69r-76v) – X(8/fols. 77r-84v) – XI(8/fols. 85r-92v) – XII(8/fols. 93r-100v) – XIII(8/fols. 101r-108v) – XIV(8/fols. 109r-116v) – XV(8/fols. 117r-124v) – XVI(8/fols. 125r-132v) – XVII(4/fols. 133r-136v)
Reinforcing strips of parchment between fols. 1 and 2.

taunit.rl-info: Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are partly visible (s. fol. 75r). Ruling pricks are mostly visible (s. fol. 85r). The upper line is written above (s. fol. 119r) or below (s. fol. 86r) the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.

rubrications.rubrication:
Nomina sacra; name of the ruling King (not always, s. fol. 30rb); names of the donors; incipits and headings of the texts; directives for the ministers; the word ሃሌ፡ ሉያ፡; some of the musical notation signs above the lines; abbreviations (sometimes partially rubricated); elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals.
In fols. 3r, 16r, 43r, 53r and 56r, the text is written alternately in red and black lines.

abbreviations.abbreviation: (ይ)ካ፡ for (ይበል፡) ካህን፡ (ይ)ዲ፡ for (ይበል፡) ዲያቆን፡ (ይ)ሕ፡ for (ይበል፡) ሕዝብ፡ ቡራ፡ for ቡራኬ፡

extras.extra: - Ethiopic numerals written in vertical lines beside the drawing; several words (magic spell?) crudely written above the drawing: fol. 2r. - European numerals, sometimes accompanied by Roman letters, crudely written above the text: fols. 3v, 4r, 4v, 5v, 6v, 7v, etc. (in the upper margin). - Fol. 40rb-va (the lower part of col. rb and the upper part of col. va) is left blank for unclear reasons. - Crude notes: fols. 67r, 73r, 76r, 82r, 87v, 96v, 103r, 111r, 121r, 126r, 133r (in the upper margin). - Some portions of the text are underlined with lilac ink (s. fols. 27ra-rb, 31rb, 33rb, 34rb, etc.). - Some portions of the text are written in compressed script (s. fols. 45v, 46r, 46v, etc.). - Immediate correction (word between two thin lines): fol. 123vb.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Green thread are inserted in the edge of fol. 16; bright red thread is inserted in the edge of fol. 94.

drawing.details: Schematic representation of the Eucharistic bread and its distribution among the participants of the Liturgy. Crudely drawn, unfinished. Crude inscriptions beside the drawing.
Schematic representation of the Eucharistic bread and its distribution among the participants of the Liturgy. Crudely drawn, unfinished.
Schematic representation of the Eucharistic bread and its distribution among the participants of the Liturgy. The portions are indicated by inscriptions in each cell.
Crude drawing of a square divided into several rectangles. Unfinished.

Schematic representation of the Eucharistic bread and its distribution among the participants of the Liturgy. Crudely drawn, unfinished. Inscription beside the drawing: እግዚእነ፡ ግርስቶስ (sic)፡ ንሥግድ፡ ኵልነ፡ ሀበ፡ ቆመ፡ እግረ፡ ክቡር፡ ሃለቃ፡ ገብረ፡ ዮሐንስ፡ አድሃኖም፡
